Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of Board's determination on state protection
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Board considered both favorable and conflicting evidence regarding state protection in Colombia
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to demonstrate inability or unwillingness to avail themselves of state protection
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicants' failure to report threats to authorities and inconsistent actions with claimed fear
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Under subsection 72(1), judicial review assesses transparency, justifiability, intelligibility, and reasonableness of decision
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged procedural unfairness in the Board’s process
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution by FARC and insufficient state protection in Colombia
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed due to adequate state protection
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to mixed questions of fact and law
Key_Evidence_Considered: Government efforts to combat guerrilla groups
Applicants’ lack of reporting to police
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Board erred in assessing subjective fear and state protection
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Subsection 72(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Overturning of Board's decision and referral for re-determination
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under federal court system
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Persecution based on political opinion or membership in social group

Crimes.Victim_Status: Civilians targeted for non-compliance with armed group demands
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Ongoing human rights issues in region
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Existence of state protection mechanisms in urban centers like Bogota
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Not applicable – threat from non-state actor
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Insufficient to establish lack of state protection
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Questioned due to applicants’ failure to report incidents or seek asylum elsewhere
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Lack of genuine subjective fear inferred from conduct
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Potential risk from FARC but mitigated by state capacity
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Targeted threats for refusal to cooperate with armed group
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Colombia, particularly areas affected by FARC activity
Crimes.Applicable_Statute: IRPA, sections related to Convention refugee status
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Alleged errors in factual analysis and credibility assessment

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Assessment of subjective fear and adequacy of state protection
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Board evaluated credibility based on lack of reporting and alternative options
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to prove well-founded fear and lack of state protection
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Failure to report threats and bypassing U.S. asylum opportunity
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Mixed questions of fact and law reviewed on reasonableness standard
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Alleged error in credibility and protection assessment
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution by FARC after refusing compliance
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed due to sufficient state protection
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Process found fair and in accordance with principles of natural justice
Key_Evidence_Considered: Lack of engagement with Colombian authorities
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Board failed to properly assess fear and protection availability
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Administrative law standards applied to IRB decisions
Crimes.Defendant_Response: State has effective protection mechanisms in place
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Recognition as refugees and protection in Canada
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under federal court jurisdiction
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Persecution due to political opinion or social group
